question: 太い
sourceMnemonic: This is a single kanji with an <ja>い</ja> on the end, meaning you know it's probably an adjective. What's the adjective form of the <kanji>fat</kanji>? It's the same: <vocabulary>fat</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic:
This is the kun'yomi reading of the kanji (because it's a single kanji, all alone with hiragana attached). The part you have to remember is the <ja>ふと</ja> portion. Let's use a mnemonic. 

The <vocabulary>fat</vocabulary> guy looked down and couldn't see his <reading>foot</reading> (<ja>ふと</ja>).
